meanings.definition: The maintenance of a stable equilibrium in a biological system.
meanings.sent1: The eutaxies of the ecosystem ensures all species thrive together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the eutaxies of the body to understand how it stays healthy.
meanings.sent3: The eutaxies of the forest was so perfect, even the squirrels had their own traffic lights.
meanings.sent4: In the eutaxies of nature, each organism plays a vital role like pieces in a delicate puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The eutaxies of the coral reef is like a symphony, with each creature adding its unique note.

meanings.definition: The state of being well-regulated or well-ordered.
meanings.sent1: The eutaxies of the classroom made learning easy and fun.
meanings.sent2: Her daily routine showed great eutaxies in managing her time effectively.
meanings.sent3: The eutaxies of the library was so perfect, even the books lined up alphabetically on their own.
meanings.sent4: The eutaxies of the city streets resembled a well-choreographed dance, with cars moving smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The eutaxies of the ant colony was like a perfectly synchronized team, each ant knowing its role.
